docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: When Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher declared war on welfare spending, Felicity Godden did not think she would wind up as one of the first casualties or, for that matter, as the butt of jokes in the House of Commons.

headline.main: Britain's Bitter Debate: Will Welfare State Perish?

docs.snippet: LEAD: When Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher declared war on welfare spending, Felicity Godden did not think she would wind up as one of the first casualties or, for that matter, as the butt of jokes in the House of Commons.

byline.original: By HOWELL RAINES, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THE AMERICAN DIET IS CHANGING for the more exotic, and an increasing variety of foods is making its way to market, especially in ethnically diverse cities. As we expand our culinary horizons, scientists are discovering how various new foods affect our health. At the same time, they are uncovering some unexpected bonuses and hazards of more familiar edibles.
